suppress.notes: insecure randomness vulnerability when using SecureRandomFactoryBean#setSeed to configure a SecureRandom instance. In order to be impacted, an honest application must provide a seed and make the resulting random material available to an attacker for inspection. Waiting for an update of org.springframework.boot to address this issue. This one seems to be false positive targeting old spring security 5.0.5
CVE is a json vulnerability for Node projects. False positive reported at https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/2794
